description: Daria Tomenko and a group of trusted technicians begin collaborating to diagnose and resolve BCI issues. Work revolves around patching critical faults temporarily.
Technicians propose to the Council a plan for granting temporary override capabilities to select senior staff to aid in system stabilization.
Council officially announces the formation of a crisis committee dedicated to regaining control over BCI subsystems following recent destabilizations.
Efforts by the crisis committee, including external expertise, begin visibly improving BCI stability, though broader system functionality remains inconsistent.
Internal discussions reveal varying opinions on permanent system solutions, leading to further proposals for iterative testing.
Senior technicians are granted interim override capabilities to enhance system reliability, following recommendations from the crisis committee.
Council reports significant improvements in BCI stability, although ongoing urban delays continue to provoke citizen frustration.
